com.galarzaa.androidthings

Class Rc522

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.galarzaa.androidthings.Rc522

  • public class Rc522
extends java.lang.Object
    Library to interact with the RFID-RC522 module
    Based on pi-rc22 by ondryaso
    Author:
    Allan Galarza
    See Also:
    MFRC522 Reference

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rc522

        @Deprecated
public Rc522(android.content.Context context,
                         com.google.android.things.pio.SpiDevice spiDevice,
                         com.google.android.things.pio.Gpio resetPin)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. use Rc522(SpiDevice, Gpio) instead.
        Initializes RC522 with the configured SPI port and pins.
        Parameters:
        context - Parameter no longer used, use Rc522(SpiDevice, Gpio) instead.
        spiDevice - SPI port used on the board
        resetPin - Pin connected to the RST pin on the RC522
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • Rc522

             com.google.android.things.pio.Gpio resetPin)
      throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes RC522 with the configured SPI port and pins.
        Parameters:
        spiDevice - SPI port used on the board
        resetPin - Pin connected to the RST pin on the RC522
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        public void setDebugging(boolean debugging)

      • getUid

        public byte[] getUid()
        Gets the UID of the last card that was successfully read. This may be empty if no card has been read before.
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the card's UID.

      • getUuid

        @Deprecated
public byte[] getUuid()
        Deprecated. Method renamed, use getUid() instead
        Gets the UID of the last card that was successfully read. This may be empty if no card has been read before.

      • getUidString

        public java.lang.String getUidString(java.lang.String separator)
        Returns a string representation of the last read tag's UID
        Parameters:
        separator - The character that separates each element of the uid
        Returns:
        A string representing the tag's UID

      • getUidString

        public java.lang.String getUidString()
        Returns a string representation of the last read tag's UID, separated by '-'

        Requests for a tag
        Returns:
        true if a tag is present

      • antiCollisionDetect

        public boolean antiCollisionDetect()
        Checks for collision errors
        Returns:
        true if there are no collision errors

      • selectTag

        public boolean selectTag(byte[] uid)
        Selects the tag to be used in following operations
        Parameters:
        uid - Byte array containing the tag's uid
        Returns:
        true if no errors occurred

      • authenticateCard

        public boolean authenticateCard(byte authMode,
                                byte address,
                                byte[] key)
        Authenticates the use of a specific address. The tag must be selected before. For reference, see section 10.3.1.9 MFAuthent in MFRC522's datasheet
        Parameters:
        authMode - The authentication mode, AUTH_A or AUTH_B
        address - The byte address of the block to authenticate for
        key - A six byte array containing the key used to authenticate
        Returns:
        true if authentication was successful

      • authenticateCard

        @Deprecated
public boolean authenticateCard(byte authMode,
                                            byte address,
                                            byte[] key,
                                            byte[] uid)
        Deprecated. use authenticateCard(byte, byte, byte[]) instead
        Authenticates the use of a specific address. The tag must be selected before. For reference, see section 10.3.1.9 MFAuthent in MFRC522's datasheet
        Parameters:
        authMode - The authentication mode, AUTH_A or AUTH_B
        address - The byte address of the block to authenticate for
        key - A six byte array containing the key used to authenticate
        uid - The tag's UID
        Returns:
        true if authentication was successful

      • stopCrypto

        public void stopCrypto()
        Ends operations that use crypto and cleans up

      • readBlock

        public boolean readBlock(byte address,
                         byte[] buffer)
        Reads the current data stored in the tag's block. Authentication is required
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the block to read data from
        buffer - the byte array to store the read data to. Length must be 16
        Returns:
        true if reading was successful

      • readBlock

        @Deprecated
public byte[] readBlock(byte address)
        Deprecated. Use readBlock(byte, byte[]) as it can report read status
        Reads the current data stored in the tag's block. Authentication is required
        Parameters:
        address - the byte address of the block to read from
        Returns:
        16 bytes array of the current value in that block

      • writeBlock

        public boolean writeBlock(byte address,
                          byte[] data)
        Writes data to a block in the tag. Authentication is required.
        Parameters:
        address - the byte address of the block to write to
        data - 16 byte array with the data that wants to be written
        Returns:
        true if writing was successful

      • write

        @Deprecated
public boolean write(byte address,
                                 byte[] data)
        Deprecated. renamed to writeBlock(byte, byte[]).
        Writes data to a block in the tag. Authentication is required.
        Parameters:
        address - the byte address of the block to write to
        data - 16 byte array with the data that wants to be written

      • increaseBlock

        public boolean increaseBlock(byte address,
                             int operand)
        Increases the value of a block by the specified operand. The data is stored in the internal transfer buffer. The block must be a value block. Tag must be selected and block authenticated
        Parameters:
        address - the block's address
        operand - the sum's operand
        Returns:
        true if operation was successful

      • decreaseBlock

        public boolean decreaseBlock(byte address,
                             int operand)
        Decreases the value of a block by the specified operand. The data is stored in the internal transfer buffer. The block must be a value block. Tag must be selected and block authenticated
        Parameters:
        address - the block's address
        operand - the substraction's operand
        Returns:
        true if operation was successful

      • transferBlock

        public boolean transferBlock(byte address)
        Writes the contents of the transfer buffer to a block
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the block to write to
        Returns:
        true if operation was successful

      • restoreBlock

        public boolean restoreBlock(byte address)
        Writes on the transfer buffer the contents of a value block
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the block to read from
        Returns:
        true if operation was successful

      • writeValue

        public boolean writeValue(byte address,
                          int value)
        Writes a 32-bit signed integer to a value block in the required format The format is specified in section 8.6.2.1 in MIFARE 1k's datasheet Tag must be selected and block authenticated
        Parameters:
        address - the block's address
        value - new value to be written to the block
        Returns:
        true if writing was successful

      • readValue

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Integer readValue(byte address)
        Reads a value block and converts the stored value
        Parameters:
        address - the block's address
        Returns:
        null,if read failed, otherwise it returns an Integer object containing the 32-bit signed value

      • writeTrailer

        public boolean writeTrailer(byte sector,
                            byte[] keyA,
                            byte[] accessBits,
                            byte userData,
                            byte[] keyB)
        Writes a sector's trailer's data. This block contains the access configuration for the entire sector, caution must be taken when modifying its contents as it can lead to inaccessible sectors. Please refer to the tag's documentation Tag must be selected and sector authenticated first
        Parameters:
        sector - the sector's number
        keyA - the new key A that will be set
        accessBits - the access bits that will be set. Can be obtained with calculateAccessBits(byte[], byte[], byte[])
        userData - a single byte containing user data
        keyB - the new key B that will be set
        Returns:
        true if writing was successful, false otherwise or if parameters are invalid
        See Also:
        Reference sheet

      • getBlockAddress

        public static byte getBlockAddress(byte sector,
                                   byte block)
        MIFARE tags blocks are organized in sectors, this calculates the address of a block in a specific sector
        Parameters:
        sector - the sector number
        block - the sector's block
        Returns:
        the block's absolute address

      • getBlockAddress

        public static byte getBlockAddress(int sector,
                                   int block)
        MIFARE tags blocks are organized in sectors, this calculates the address of a block in a specific sector
        Parameters:
        sector - the sector number
        block - the sector's block

      • dataToHexString

        public static java.lang.String dataToHexString(byte[] data)
        Converts a data byte array to a string representing its 16 bytes in hexadecimal
        Parameters:
        data - the byte array holding the data
        Returns:
        A string representing the block's data

      • dumpMifare1k

        public java.lang.String dumpMifare1k()
        Dumps all the data in all data blocks in MIFARE 1K cards with default authentication keys. Card must be selected using selectTag(byte[]) before This won't work if a sector's KEY A or access bits have been changed
        Returns:
        string containing all the data

      • calculateAccessBits

        public static byte[] calculateAccessBits(byte[] c1,
                                         byte[] c2,
                                         byte[] c3)
        Calculates the access bits for a sector trailer (bytes 6 to 7) based on Table 6 and Table 7 on MIFARE 1k's reference
        Parameters:
        c1 - byte array for the c1 values for block 0, 1, 2 and 3 respectively
        c2 - byte array for the c2 values for block 0, 1, 2 and 3 respectively
        c3 - byte array for the c3 values for block 0, 1, 2 and 3 respectively
        Returns:
        a 3 byte array containing the access bits
        See Also:
        Reference sheet

      • calculateAccessBits

        public static byte[] calculateAccessBits(byte[][] accessConditions)
        Calculates the access bits for a sector trailer (bytes 6 to 7) based on Table 6 and Table 7 on MIFARE 1k's reference
        Parameters:
        accessConditions - a 2d array containing the access conditions for each block
        Returns:
        a 3 byte array containing the access bits

      • calculateAccessConditions

        public static byte[][] calculateAccessConditions(byte[] accessBits)
        Calculates the individual access conditions given the access bits
        Parameters:
        accessBits - 3 bytes array containing the access bits of a sector trailer (bytes 6 to 7)
        Returns:
        a 3-item array representing each of the access conditions (c1,c2,c3), each containing a byte array for the values of each block (0 to 3)
